intro: Porpax articulata, commonly known as the articulated liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is a small, leafy liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thallus that is segmented into distinct, finger-like structures called rhizoids, which help in anchoring and absorbing nutrients. Its reproductive structures include capsules that release spores, contributing to its propagation. Porpax articulata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
